bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, July 29, 1950

div1.p: Lawrence Reed thanks Hench for his expression of sympathy on his mother's death, and expresses regret that Hench could not serve as a pallbearer. He describes the funeral.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, July 29, 1950

opener.dateline:
MAJOR GENERAL WALTER L. REED
2810 THIRTY SIX PLACE
WASHINGTON, D. C.
July 29th 50

div1.p:
Landon & I deeply appreciate
your touching telegram. Mother's passing
was peaceful, although toward the end
she had lost all touch with those dear to
her.

The respect and sympathy
expressed by the mountain people she had
known for so many years touched us
beyond words-

Tuesday was a beautiful day and
the presence of so many distinguished officers
of the Medical Corps, acting as honorary pall-
bearers at Arlington was a wonderful tribute
to my Father.

We deeply regretted your
inability to have been one of mothers
pall bearers-

Again let me express and
R
appreciation to you & Mrs Hench for
your understanding sympathy and the
beautiful roses.
With warmest regards for you both
